TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TaxonomyWebTaggingControl extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl
Public NotInheritable Class TaxonomyWebTaggingControl Inherits WebControl
public ref class TaxonomyWebTaggingControl sealed : System::Web::UI::WebControls::WebControl

Docs.summary: Represents a generic Web control for picking managed metadata terms.

remarks.para: A object is a Web control that can be added to a page so that a user can pick one or more taxonomy object from a specific object or from an entire object.

This control ensures that all terms are valid, and if they are not, it requires validation from the user when it finds an invalid term. If the TermStore or TermSet connection cannot be established, the TaxonomyWebTaggingControl will be disabled.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of valid terms corresponding to the value of the property.

remarks.para: Only valid terms are returned. If no valid term are found, an empty list is returned. All new, invalid or unvalidated terms entered by the user are ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsAddTerms { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets and sets whether this control will try to add unresolved objects to the object.
Docs.value: Whether this control will try to add unresolved terms to the TermSet.

remarks.para: If this property is set to true and an unvalidated Term is left in the control, the control will try to add it to the TermSet to validate it. This will only occur if the TermSetId count is set to 1.

remarks.para: If the property is set to true the control cannot allow browsing with the picker.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SetValidatedTerms (System.Collections.Generic.List<Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.Term> terms, out string reason);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SetValidatedTerms(class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<class Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.Term> terms, [out] string& reason) cil managed
Public Function SetValidatedTerms (terms As List(Of Term), ByRef reason As String) As Boolean

Docs.param: A list of terms to be validated. The list can be empty, but this parameter must not be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
A localized string describing why the new list failed to validate. If all the terms are valid, or if the list is empty, this will contain .
Docs.summary: Sets the value of the property to correspond to the list, and triggers server-side validation of the new value.
Docs.returns: if all of the terms specified in the list are valid; otherwise, .

remarks.para: The existing value of the control's property is overwritten, even when any terms in the list are invalid. If the list is empty, the Text property will be set to .

Docs.exception: The parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the IDs of the T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TermStore objects that this control will validate against.
Docs.value: Term store IDs that are used to resolve terms

remarks.para: The value passed into this method or returned from this method is a ; delimited list of GUID's that are the TermStore.Id values of the TermStore objects that the control should resolve against.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Text { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets input from and sets output to the object.
Docs.value: Label/GUID pairs that represent a object that is displayed in the control

remarks.para: Set values into this control as pairs of labels and GUIDs. The delimiter between a label and a GUID is the | character. When using multiple values, delimit them with a ; character. Example: term1|12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012;term2|87654321-4321-4321-4321-210987654321

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Validate([out] string& reason) cil managed
Public Function Validate (ByRef reason As String) As Boolean

Docs.param: The message shown in the UI to the user if the data is not valid
Docs.summary: Checks whether the data in the current TaxonomyWebTaggingControl object is valid and tries to validate it if has not yet been validated.
Docs.returns: true if the data is valid; otherwise, false

remarks.para: If objects appear that have not been validated on the client, this method tries to validate them. If it can find a single match to a Term, it will apply that Term. If it finds more than one match, it will return false. If it cannot find any matches and the control object is set up to create new Term objects, it will create a new Term. Running the Validate(System.String@) method can change the value of the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Uri ^ WebServiceUrl { Uri ^ get(); void set(Uri ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the URL of the TaxonomyInternalService that will be used to resolve against.
Docs.value: URL of the TaxonomyInternalService that will used to resolve against.

remarks.para: If this value is not set the SPContext.Current.Web will be used to determine the TaxonomyInternalService to be used.
